Interface_name: Advanced HTTP client with custom http.Client and request headers
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Go struct that provides HTTP client functionality for making GET and POST requests with custom headers and query parameters.

Struct Description: The `request` struct encapsulates HTTP client operations, providing methods to perform GET and POST requests with support for custom headers and query parameters. It handles URL construction, request execution, and response processing.

Fields:
[Note: The reference implementation doesn't show any struct fields, as it's a stateless utility struct]

Methods:

Method1: HttpGet(queryUrl string, queryValues map[string]string, headerValues map[string]string) -> ([]byte, int, error) - Performs an HTTP GET request to the specified URL with the given query parameters and headers. Returns the response body as bytes, status code, and any error.

Method2: HttpPost(queryUrl string, queryValues map[string]string, headerValues map[string]string) -> ([]byte, int, error) - Performs an HTTP POST request to the specified URL with the given form data (as query parameters) and headers. Returns the response body as bytes, status code, and any error.

Method3: QueryBuilder(queryUrl string, queryValues map[string]string) -> string - Helper method that constructs a URL with query parameters from the given base URL and parameter map. Handles URL encoding of parameters.
